Regulations 2025.

title: 4 , 7 , 8 , 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as adapted
heading: These Regulations shall come into operation on 6th March 2025.
text_raw:
2. 

 These Regulations shall come into operation on 6th March 2025.

title: 4 , 7 , 8 , 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as adapted
heading: In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Student Support
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Student Support 

Regulations 2025 (S.I. No. 71 of 2025).
text_norm: 3 regulation principal regulation mean student support regulation 2025 (s.i no 71 2025)

title: 4 , 7 , 8 , 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as adapted
heading: 4. Part B of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations is amended by
text_raw:
4. Part B of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations is amended by 
substituting for the entry “Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland” the following 
entry: 

“Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland 

In respect of the following undergraduate courses: 

— 

— 

— 

— 

— 

— 

MB, BCh, BAO (LRCP, SI) [5 years] 

MB, BCh, BAO (LRCP, SI) [6 years] 

BSc (Hons) in Pharmacy [4 years] 

BSc (Hons) in Physiotherapy [4 years] 

BSc (Hons) in Advanced Therapeutic Technologies [4 years] 

Bachelor of Dental Surgery [5 years] 

In respect of the following postgraduate courses: 

— 

— 

— 

— 

Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) [4 years] 

Medical Doctorate (MD) [2 years] 

MSc by Research [2 years] 

Master of Pharmacy (M Pharm) [1 year] 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 30th September, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [438] 3 

— 

— 

— 

MSc in Technologies and Analytics in Precision Medicine [1 
year] 

MSc Physician Associate Studies [2 years] 

Master of Surgery (by Module) [1 year]”

title: 4 , 7 , 8 , 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as adapted
heading: 9. Part D of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations is amended by
text_raw:
9. Part D of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations is amended by 
substituting for the entry “South East Technological University” the following 
entry: 

“South East Technological University 

In respect of years 2 and 3 of the following courses: 

— 

BBs in Tourism and Hospitality Services 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [438] 

— 

— 

BSc in Applied Health Care 

Bachelor of Business 

In respect of years 2, 3, and 4 of the following courses: 

— 

— 

— 

— 

BSc (Hons) in Public Health and Health Promotion 

Bachelor of Business (Hons) 

BSc (Hons) in Software Development 

BSc (Hons) in Information Technology Management 

In respect of years 2, 3, 4, and 5 of the following course: 

— 

BSc (Hons) in Intellectual Disability Nursing” 

 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure, Infrastructure, Public Service Reform and 
Digitalisation consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations. 

[438] 5 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure, Infrastructure, Public Service Reform and 
Digitalisation, 

23 September, 2025. 

JACK CHAMBERS, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, Infrastructure, Public 
Service Reform and Digitalisation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 September, 2025. 

JAMES LAWLESS, 

Minister for Further and Higher Education, Research, 
Innovation and Science. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [438]

title: 4 , 7 , 8 , 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as adapted
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations are an amendment to the existing principal Regulations ( S.I. 
No. 71 of 2025) which prescribe “approved institutions” and other matters for 
the purposes of the Student Support Act 2011. These Regulations may be cited 
as the Student Support (Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 [438] 7
